attributes.comment:
To Whom It May Concern:
As an adoptive parent, I am particularly concerned about the affect the potential
fee increase for petitions at USCIS would have on adoptive families. I recommend
that fees for adoption should not be changed. Many adoptive parents have to file
the I-600A TWICE because approval is only good for 18 months. Having to pay
the full price and file again substantially impacts the cost of adoption.

A family looking to adopt currently has the following fees to anticipate:
I600A: $545
Fingerprints: $70 x 2 = $140
Total: $685 (for many families, multiply by 2 for having to file twice)

What it will be now (assuming approval runs out and family must file twice) plus
the increase:
I600A: $670 x 2 = $1340
Fingerprints: $80 x 4 = $ 320
Total: $1660

That's an increase of $975 or over 140%! That kind of an increase seems hard to
justify, without an increase in services. Where is that profit going to go?

Additionally, adoptive families also will be impacted by the increase in the
children's Certificate of Citizenship (for IR4 visas) fee, which would change from
$215 to $460, a difference of $245 or about 120% increase.

Please rethink increasing these fees on behalf of adoptive families and all the
ophans waiting for families. Or, perhaps increase the amount of time the I600A
approval is good for.

Thanks,
Jessica
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Jessica Cunningham
